text: today's recipe is one of my favorites
that I've developed probably all year
it's a caramel stuffed humongous chewy
chocolate chip cookie you guys are going
to adore it to start off with I had one
and a half cups of light brown sugar in
my bowl and I'm adding 3 cups of
all-purpose flour
you also need 1/2 a cup of granulated
sugar so the brown sugar is there
because it adds like moist chewiness and
then you get a little bit of sort of
clean sugar flavor I guess for lack of a
better term by adding the white sugar
and also like a crunch so these are
chewing the center and crunchy on the
outside if they're baked properly add a
teaspoon of salt you'll also need 1
teaspoon of baking powder and 3/4 of a
teaspoon of baking soda you'll notice
probably you're like what is she doing
I'm mixing all of my ingredients in the
bowl this is not creaming method like
most of our cookie recipes but it's a
reverse creaming method where you mix
together all your dry ingredients all of
your dry ingredients together you're
combining everything you're distributing
you're leaveners throughout all the dry
ingredients and then you'll add your
butter two sticks of cold unsalted
butter so instead of room-temperature
butter you're using cold butter now you
want to beat your butter in and you're
just looking to break it down into sort
of pea-sized pieces kind of like you're
making a pie crust but what's also
happening right now is that the butter
is coating the flour mixture so you're
going to end up with a more tender
coating to don't turn it on too high
because if you get it too high the flour
is going to come flying out and then
you'll be mad
and I don't want you being mad at me I
want you to be happy so now all the
flour has basically been sort of coated
with like that and there's some
pea-sized pieces left and that's good
I'm gonna add my chocolate chips it's 12
ounces which is a full bag of semi-sweet
chocolate chips gonna beat that just for
a sec on low to combine and then you can
add your eggs it's two large eggs go
ahead and use my butter bowl

and then a teaspoon of pure vanilla
extract
batter is done is scooped one-third of a

going to stuff these with caramel I'm
using three half caramels you should be
less soft chewy candy caramels roll it
into a ball and then put it on the
baking sheet you can fit about six of
these baseball sized cookies we found
that the best way to cook these and keep
them nice and soft was to freeze them
for a few minutes so after I shape them
I'm gonna get them into the freezer for
about 15 minutes and then you bake them
straight from the freezer if you like
them super chewy and less cooked you can
actually freeze them all the way through
sort of depends on exactly how
underbaked you like your cookies we're
going for baked but still slightly chewy
right before you put them in the freezer
start preheating your oven you want it
at 375 degrees okay so just get these
into the oven at 375 and bacon 14 and
then reduce the heat to 350 and bake
until the top is just set about 7 to 10
